f6_assessments.q0: This proposal's problem statement and solution matches with the challenge. By tokenizing game as NFT, this will not only provide entertainment but a way for incentivizing players in real world. With their plan to be able to interoperate with other networks and collaborate with real world companies to produce a product or even advertise within the game shows that the project has the potential to scale to millions of users. I believe this game will add utility to Cardano, giving it more value.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposers provided verifiable credentials on the team members with evidence of skills and experience to successfully implement the project. Moreover, the proposer presented the budget breakdown in clear and identifiable way. Furthermore, the proposer explained the details of required manpower and resources needed to execute the project. However, there is no statement on what are the risks and challenges involved during the development of the game.
f6_assessments.q2: The roadmap provided is unclear, provide a roadmap with timeframe of what will be done within 3,6,12 months time for auditability of the project progress.

f6_assessments.q0: The projects aims to redirect money into people's hands by having a play to earn, build to earn and other incentives. The game being accessible on a wide range of devices will most certainly benefit many community members without the need to spend expensively on specialized gaming equipment. I strongly agree the proposed idea will address some of the problems in gaming scene.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposal does not in detail state the exact size, competences of the entire team, however using plutus pioneer graduates gives this project an advantage as the talent is eager to put their skills into building something meaningful and something that they are passionate about.
f6_assessments.q2: The proposal does not show details of the expenditure and budget with meaningful timelines, or a code base, however there is a website where the community can track the progress at a glance. No risks or challenge assessment has been conducted for the scope of the project and its delivery of the various modules/services to the community.

f6_assessments.q0: Cornucopias is NFT-blockchain game with free-to-play multiplayer world where you can create and participate in various games/use-cases. As this challenge is about NFT business models I would like to see more information about the underlying business model of this game, which is only roughly mentioned. In terms of impact of this proposal, it would be good to see a reflection on how this game differs from others and how it adds value to Cardano. This topic is only mentioned in passing. Based on the given information, I can rate impact only with three stars.
f6_assessments.q1: The team has already been very active in Cardano and Catalyst over the last months and has already delivered a Fund 3 project. The development of the game has already started. And the requested amount will be used for hiring additional 3 developers to the team. The requested amount therefore sounds very reasonable. For a better assessment I would recommend to add more information about the technical architecture and also the go-to-market strategy. Because building this game is one thing, but running it successfully is a different story. Overall, based on the team and the progress so far, I expect a successful implementation.
f6_assessments.q2: The roadmap and timeline are clear described. Success is defined as well: 1 million gamers in the first 3 years. But it is not really described how they are planning to reach this number, (what are the milestones). So this number is not very useful to audit this proposal. To improve this proposal, I recommend to add a documentation source where the community can audit the progress of this proposal.

f6_assessments.q0: The proposal addresses the challenge.  Games on other blockchains have been very successful in promoting NFT usage.
f6_assessments.q1: The vision is fully described in the proposal and the white paper.   This proposal covers a segment of the development, but the bulk of development is self-funded.
f6_assessments.q2: The proposal could benefit from more specific milestones regarding the development of smart contracts.

f6_assessments.q0: This is a great example of a non-art NFT business that would set the example for other businesses. Gamifying is a major path to adoption for any industry, and tech businesses have a lot of experience doing this already. From robinhood to learn to code apps, this has many different layers of commerce.
f6_assessments.q1: This team has already completed previous funding projects, and is working on another which gives me confidence in the team. That is on top of their development experience and their expertise in the game engine and design. They combine that with blockchain and plutus experience to seal the deal. Their plan is well thought out and is long term. They have multiple stages of the product from the web browser all the way to the mobile app, but their plan of implementation to properly integrate smart contracts while simultaneously expanding the game features is the correct path to success.
f6_assessments.q2: This is a complicated project and will take a few years to fully complete. They've laid out a clear path with key milestones and measurements of success that cover their progress and success thoroughly. We will be able to audit the progress of the smart contracts with transparency, and we will be able to measure the number of active users very accurately.

solution: 'The Island' is an NFT blockchain game where players own land and other NFTs assets. Smart Contracts are the key to making it a success.
experience: We have over 20 years experience in development and a growing team of Game developers, analysts, designers and blockchain experts.
